text: The men's coxless pair competition at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro was held from 6 to 11 August at the Lagoon Rodrigo de Freitas. The medals for the competition were presented by Barry Maister, New Zealand, member of the International Olympic Committee, and the gifts were presented by Jean-Christophe Rolland, France, President of the International Rowing Federation. ==Results== ===Heats=== First three of each heat qualify to the semifinals, remainder goes to the repechage. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc |1 |Spencer Turrin Alexander Lloyd | |6:40.79 |SF |--bgcolor=ccffcc |2 |Lawrence Brittain Shaun Keeling | |6:41.42 |SF |-bgcolor=ccffcc |3 |Jakub Podrazil Lukáš Helešic | |6:42.710 |SF |- |4 |Anders Weiss Nareg Guregian | |6:49.97 |R |- |5 |Àlex Sigurbjörnsson Pau Vela | |6:54.26 |R |- |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc |1 |Germain Chardin Dorian Mortelette | |6:42.00 |SF |--bgcolor=ccffcc |2 |Alan Sinclair Stewart Innes | |6:50.77 |SF |--bgcolor=ccffcc |3 |Cristi-Ilie Pârghie George Alexandru Pălămariu | |6:51.71 |SF |- |4 |Roel Braas Mitchel Steenman | |7:22.93 |R |- |} ====Heat 3==== Many of the competitors criticised that the regatta was not called off due to the challenging conditions. Miloš Vasić and Nenad Beđik capsized and did not get back into the boat, but the International Rowing Federation (FISA) ruled that despite their DNF they could compete in the repechage. {|class="wikitable" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc |1 |Eric Murray Hamish Bond | |6:41.75 |SF |--bgcolor=ccffcc |2 |Giovanni Abagnale Marco Di Constanzo | |6:46.04 |SF |--bgcolor=ccffcc |3 |Adrián Juhász Béla Simon | |6:59.28 |SF |- |4 |Miloš Vasić Nenad Beđik | |DNF (capsized) |R |} ===Repechage=== First three of heat qualify to the semifinals. {|class="wikitable"
